message.content: Caveat: The messages below were generated by the user while running local commands. DO NOT respond to these messages or otherwise consider them in your response unless the user explicitly asks you to.

⏺ Done. Here's the structure:

  Branch: fix/linkcells-page-boundary (fix + test only)
  - https://github.com/0xBigBoss/ghostty/commit/c02cf6418 - fix
  - https://github.com/0xBigBoss/ghostty/commit/9a2354833 - test

  Stacked Branch: fix/kitty-overflow-logging (includes instrumentation)
  - https://github.com/0xBigBoss/ghostty/commit/4ecd378d6 - renderer logging

  origin/main
      │
      └── c02cf6418 fix(terminal): use page-relative y in linkCells
              │
              └── 9a2354833 test(terminal): regression test  ← fix/linkcells-page-boundary
                      │
                      └── 4ecd378d6 renderer: log kitty overflow  ← fix/kitty-overflow-logging


Lets clear our my ghostty crash states in the hopes of focusing on the renderer bug that keeps crashing my ghostty. See @README.md

content.thinking:
The user wants to clear their Ghostty crash states to focus on a renderer bug. According to the README.md I just read, crash reports are saved to `$XDG_STATE_HOME/ghostty/crash` directory, with the default being `~/.local/state` if `$XDG_STATE_HOME` is not set.

Let me help them clear these crash states.

content.text: I'll help you clear the Ghostty crash states. Based on the README, crash reports are stored in `$XDG_STATE_HOME/ghostty/crash` (defaulting to `~/.local/state/ghostty/crash`).

input.command: ls -la "${XDG_STATE_HOME:-$HOME/.local/state}/ghostty/crash" 2>/dev/null || echo "Directory not found or empty"

content.thinking: There are 16 crash reports totaling about 55MB. Let me clear them for the user.

content.text: Found 16 crash reports (~54MB). Clearing them now.

content.content:
The user doesn't want to proceed with this tool use. The tool use was rejected (eg. if it was a file edit, the new_string was NOT written to the file). To tell you how to proceed, the user said:
actually just back them up

toolUseResult:
Error: The user doesn't want to proceed with this tool use. The tool use was rejected (eg. if it was a file edit, the new_string was NOT written to the file). To tell you how to proceed, the user said:
actually just back them up

content.thinking: The user wants to back up the crash reports instead of deleting them. Let me create a backup directory and move them there.

input.command: backup_dir="${XDG_STATE_HOME:-$HOME/.local/state}/ghostty/crash-backup-$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S)" && mkdir -p "$backup_dir" && mv "${XDG_STATE_HOME:-$HOME/.local/state}/ghostty/crash"/*.ghosttycrash "$backup_dir/" && echo "Backed up to: $backup_dir" && ls "$backup_dir" | wc -l | xargs -I{} echo "{} crash reports moved"
input.description: Backup crash reports to timestamped dir

content.content:
Exit code 1
mkdir: cannot create directory ‘’: No such file or directory

toolUseResult:
Error: Exit code 1
mkdir: cannot create directory ‘’: No such file or directory

content.thinking: The XDG_STATE_HOME or the path expansion failed. Let me check what the actual path is.

input.command: crash_dir="${XDG_STATE_HOME:-$HOME/.local/state}/ghostty/crash" && backup_dir="$crash_dir-backup-$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S)" && echo "Moving from: $crash_dir" && echo "Moving to: $backup_dir" && mkdir -p "$backup_dir" && mv "$crash_dir"/*.ghosttycrash "$backup_dir/" && echo "Done - $(ls "$backup_dir" | wc -l | tr -d ' ') files backed up"
input.description: Backup crash reports with explicit paths

Moving to: /Users/allen/.local/state/ghostty/crash-backup-20251218-145456
Done - 16 files backed up

content.thinking: Successfully backed up 16 crash reports to the timestamped backup directory. The crash directory is now clear for new crashes related to the renderer bug.

content.text:
Done. Backed up 16 crash reports to:
`~/.local/state/ghostty/crash-backup-20251218-145456`

The crash directory is now empty - any new crashes from the renderer bug will be easier to isolate.
